alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 6:30AM EDT until April 08 at 1:26PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. Oconee River near Dublin affecting Wilkinson, Laurens, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Alabama... Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19 affecting Talbot, Upson, Taylor and Crawford Counties. Oconee River near Milledgeville affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Baldwin Counties. Chattahoochee River at Columbus affecting Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Lee and Russell Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to end later today. * WHERE...Flint River near Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 12.3 feet steady. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EDT Friday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage later this morning and continue falling to 5.2 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 12 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
